title: Percent, Ratio, and Money Practice
description: Practice percent, ratio, and money word problems using real-life images

questions.question: Look at the image `ratio-apples-oranges.png`. What is the ratio of apples to oranges?
questions.explanation: The image shows 3 apples and 2 oranges, so the ratio is 3:2.

questions.question: Using the image `percent-hundred-grid.png`, how many squares are shaded?
questions.explanation: The hundred grid shows 25 shaded squares.

questions.question: In the image `money-change-example.png`, the customer pays $50 for a $25 item. The change is ______.
Look at the image `discount-shopping-tag.png`. What percent discount is shown?
If an item costs $100 and uses the discount shown in `discount-shopping-tag.png`, what is the discount amount?
The ratio shown in `ratio-apples-oranges.png` can be simplified.
Explain how the image `percent-hundred-grid.png` helps you understand percent.
questions.correctAnswer: It shows how many parts out of 100 are shaded.
questions.explanation: Percent means out of 100, and the grid visually shows this.
